name: Eating Places Quiz / Test | Names, Maps and Borders | 20 Questions

questions.text: A deep gorge in South Western England and the name of a popular cheese?
questions.explanation:
Cheddar.

	Cheddar Gorge is in Somerset, it is known for its steep limestone cliffs and caves.

questions.text: A river in South Africa, and a citrus fruit?
questions.explanation:
Orange.

	The Orange River is the longest in South Africa.

questions.text: A town in Kent, England and the generic name of a popular snack food?
questions.explanation:
Sandwich.

	Sandwich Islands is also the former name for Hawaii.

questions.text: Island in the Mediterranean that gives its name to a small fish found mainly in tins?
questions.explanation:
Sardinia.

	Sardines are actually young pilchards, which belong to the herring family.

questions.text: An Italian type of 'pie' that sounds like the city of the 'leaning tower'?
questions.explanation:
Pizza.

	Pisa is famous for its leaning tower, one of the architectural marvels of the world. Pizza is now popular all over the world.

questions.text: A citrus fruit that sounds as if it came from a city in Northern Africa?
questions.explanation:
Tangerine.

	Tangier was under the control of several European colonial powers over the centuries, and it is located in Northern Morocco.

questions.text: The nickname of a famous American city or a large popular fruit?
questions.explanation:
The Big Apple & Big Apple.

	The Big Apple is the nickname for New York City.

questions.text: Which of these is a city in India or a popular curry dish?
questions.explanation:
Madras.

	Madras is one of the principal ports of India. It is on the Bay of Bengal. Bombay also has a curry named for it.

questions.text: A country in South America that sounds like a popular spicy dish?
questions.explanation:
Chile.

	Chile is on the west coast of South America. Chili is a 'HOT' Mexican dish.

questions.text: A Mexican State or a 'red hot' sauce?
questions.explanation:
Tabasco.

	Tabasco is a Mexican State located partly in the Yucatan Peninsula.

questions.text: Mountain range in California or a generic ingredient in candy?
questions.explanation:
Chocolate.

	The Chocolate Mountains are located between the Colorado River and the Salton Sea in Southern California.

questions.text: A US state capital that has a substance used for food preparation in its name?
questions.explanation:
Salt Lake City.

	Salt Lake City is in Utah, it is the state capital and home to the Utah Jazz professional basketball team.

questions.text: A popular dessert that is named after a U.S. state?
questions.explanation:
Baked Alaska.

	Baked Alaska is a cake with ice cream inside, and browned in a hot oven.

questions.text: A famous cake that might have come from an Alpine country?
questions.explanation:
Swiss Roll.

	Swiss Roll is apparently not available in Switzerland.

questions.text: A cut of meat that is named after an English city?
questions.explanation:
London Broil.

	London Broil most often refers to a thick flank steak, broiled and thinly sliced.

questions.text: A mollusk that is named after the area of Queens N.Y.?
questions.explanation:
Little Neck Clams.

	Little Neck clams are much sought after.

questions.text: An area of Long Island or a favorite mollusk?
questions.explanation:
Oyster Bay.

	Plenty of pearls round there I can tell you.

questions.text: A city in Holland or a cheese?
questions.explanation:
Gouda.

	Gouda is a 'hard' cheese, so termed because of the cheddaring process used to make it.

questions.text: A Euro-Asian country or a Thanksgiving bird?
questions.explanation:
Turkey.

	Turkeys are native to America and were at one time considered for the national symbol of the United States.

questions.text: The capital of the Ukraine or a tasty chicken dish?
questions.explanation:
Kiev & Chicken Kiev.

	The largest city in the Ukraine, Kiev is located by the Dnieper River.
